poem:
### An Agreement of Silence

In the quiet back rooms,  
where the clinking of dishes hangs,  
a pact of silence is signed.  
Not with gold-edged pen,  
but with the clatter of coins,  
promising not prosperity,  
but a deeper hush.  
Whispers locked in steam,  
traded for a paycheck,  
keep secrets of the invisible—  
who clean without speaking.
